oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Music & the Spoken Word - Mormon Tabernacle Choir radio program - Episode 711 Part 2 - 1943-02-28 - KSL - WLAC
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Syndicated radio broadcast of the Music & the Spoken Word radio program, originally broadcast from KSL (Salt Lake City, Utah). Recorded from Temple Square in Salt Lake City, Utah, the program is narrated by Richard L. Evans, conducted by J. Spencer Cornwall, and performed by the Mormon Tabernacle Choir with Frank W. Asper on organ. This is the second part of the 711th airing, recorded on February 28, 1943.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Frank W. Asper
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" [incomplete] / (0:23) Richard L. Evans reads a passage / (3:35) Alexander Schreiner performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" / (4:26) Richard L. Evans introduces the next performance / (4:38) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "The Lord's My Shepherd" with music composed by Thomas Koschat / (5:49) Richard L. Evans reads a passage / (6:19) The Mormon Tabernacle Choir performs "[Unconfirmed piece]" / (12:06) Richard L. Evans announces the closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; Mormon Tabernacle Choir; Music and the spoken word (Radio program); KSL (Radio station : Salt Lake City, Utah); WLAC (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.)
